thread.title: Sadiq Khan joins with UK city leaders to urge action on filthy air | London Evening Standard
thread.title_full: Sadiq Khan joins with UK city leaders to urge action on filthy air | London Evening Standard

author: Pippa Crerar
title: Sadiq Khan joins with UK city leaders to urge action on filthy air | London Evening Standard
text:
Friday 10 February 2017 11:11 GMT Click to followThe Evening Standard Warning: Sadiq Khan Lucy Young 
The leaders of Britain’s five most polluted cities today urged Theresa May to take urgent action to clean up the country’s toxic air . 
London Mayor Sadiq Khan joined forces with the leaders of four other English cities — Birmingham , Leeds, Nottingham and Derby — to call on the Prime Minister to bring in a Clean Air Act for the 21st century. 
They said enshrining the right to clean air in law after the UK leaves the European Union should be a priority. 
The cities were identified in 2015 by the Department of the Environment as having breached legal limits for air pollution, believed to contribute to the early deaths of 40,000 people a year. Read more
